alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 3:34PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS EXPECTED FOR PORTIONS OF KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST FROM TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... Changes since previous statement: - Areas north of Kipnuk are now expected to see the highest water levels. - Elevated water levels at high tide could persist through Sunday evening for these areas. A strong frontal system will bring southwesterly gale force winds with gusts 35 to 45 mph across the Kuskokwim Delta coast through tonight. The resulting higher seas and surf, in combination with high tide, could raise water levels as much as 2 to 4 feet above the normal highest tide. While much of the Kuskokwim Delta coast will likely see minor increases in water levels, the biggest impacts are expected north of Kipnuk, including the communities of Toksook Bay, Tununak, and Newtok. For these communities, elevated water levels at high tide could persist from tonight through Sunday evening. PREPAREDNESS: Residents are encouraged to move items up from the immediate coastline and monitor water levels in their community.
